questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the major bacterial phyla in the human gut microbiome?
questions.answer: Cyanobacteria

questions.question: What percentage of the gut microbiome is typically composed of Firmicutes?
Which of the following is a primary function of the gut microbiome?
questions.answer: Nutrient metabolism

questions.question: What are short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs)?
choices: Harmful compounds produced by gut bacteria
Beneficial compounds produced by gut bacteria
questions.answer: Beneficial compounds produced by gut bacteria

questions.question: Which vitamin is synthesized by gut bacteria?
questions.answer: Vitamin K

questions.question: How does the gut microbiome contribute to immune system regulation?
choices: By training and developing the immune system
By destroying all bacteria in the gut
By increasing inflammation throughout the body
questions.answer: By training and developing the immune system

questions.question: What is dysbiosis?
choices: A healthy balance of gut bacteria
An imbalance in the microbial community
questions.answer: An imbalance in the microbial community

questions.question: Which of the following factors has the most significant impact on shaping the gut microbiome?
questions.answer: Diet

questions.question: What effect do antibiotics typically have on the gut microbiome?
choices: They have no effect on the microbiome
questions.answer: They can cause significant disruption

questions.question: How does stress impact the gut microbiome?
choices: It has no effect on the microbiome
It increases the number of beneficial bacteria
questions.answer: It alters gut-brain axis communication

questions.question: What is the effect of regular exercise on the gut microbiome?
choices: It has no impact on the microbiome
questions.answer: It increases microbial diversity

questions.question: Which type of diet is associated with reduced microbial diversity?
questions.answer: Western diet

questions.question: What are prebiotics?
choices: Non-digestible food components that promote bacterial growth
questions.answer: Non-digestible food components that promote bacterial growth

questions.question: Which of the following is a good source of prebiotics?
questions.answer: Garlic

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of consuming fermented foods for gut health?
questions.answer: They introduce beneficial probiotics

questions.question: Which of the following is a traditional fermented food in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Ai-farina

questions.question: How does a high-fiber diet impact the gut microbiome?
choices: It has no effect on the microbiome
questions.answer: It promotes microbial diversity

questions.question: What is the potential impact of urbanization on the gut microbiome in Timor-Leste?
choices: It will always improve gut health
It may lead to reduced microbial diversity
It has no impact on the microbiome
It will eliminate all gut bacteria
questions.answer: It may lead to reduced microbial diversity

questions.question: Which of the following is a challenge in maintaining a healthy gut microbiome in Timor-Leste?
choices: Limited access to diverse food sources in some areas
Too much dietary fiber in the traditional diet
questions.answer: Limited access to diverse food sources in some areas

questions.question: What role does the gut microbiome play in protecting against pathogens?
choices: It competes for resources and produces antimicrobial compounds
It has no role in pathogen protection
questions.answer: It competes for resources and produces antimicrobial compounds

questions.question: How do processed foods and artificial additives typically affect the gut microbiome?
choices: They have no effect on the microbiome
They may negatively impact microbiome diversity
questions.answer: They may negatively impact microbiome diversity

questions.question: What is the relationship between the gut microbiome and the immune system?
choices: The gut microbiome suppresses the immune system
The gut microbiome has no interaction with the immune system
The gut microbiome helps train and develop the immune system
The immune system completely eliminates the gut microbiome
questions.answer: The gut microbiome helps train and develop the immune system

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential benefit of maintaining a healthy gut microbiome?
questions.answer: Improved mental health

questions.question: What is the gut-brain axis?
choices: A direct neural connection between the gut and brain
A method of measuring gut bacteria
A diet plan for improving gut health
questions.answer: A direct neural connection between the gut and brain

questions.question: How might seasonal variations in food availability affect gut microbiome health in Timor-Leste?
choices: They have no impact on the microbiome
They may lead to fluctuations in microbial diversity
questions.answer: They may lead to fluctuations in microbial diversity

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common staple food in the traditional Timorese diet?
questions.answer: Wheat

questions.question: What is the potential benefit of traditional fermented foods like ai-farina in Timor-Leste?
choices: They offer probiotics and support gut health
They are a good source of protein
questions.answer: They offer probiotics and support gut health

questions.question: How can knowledge of the gut microbiome be used to address malnutrition issues in Timor-Leste?
choices: By promoting the consumption of processed foods
By eliminating all bacteria from the gut
By encouraging dietary diversity and fermented foods
By increasing the use of antibiotics
questions.answer: By encouraging dietary diversity and fermented foods

questions.question: What is a potential challenge in implementing microbiome-based dietary interventions in rural Timorese communities?
choices: Limited access to diverse food sources
Too much emphasis on gut health in traditional medicine
questions.answer: Limited access to diverse food sources

questions.question: How does a diet high in animal protein and saturated fat typically affect the gut microbiome?
choices: It promotes a more diverse microbiome
It has no effect on the microbiome
It is associated with less favorable microbiome profiles
questions.answer: It is associated with less favorable microbiome profiles
